message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valproic acid is known to be associated with congenital malformations, fetal growth restriction, and a reduction in IQ scores. Sumatriptan, Acetaminophen, and Albuterol have not been shown to have significant adverse effects on the fetus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valproic acid has been associated with an increased risk of birth defects, including neural tube defects and cleft lip/palate. Sumatriptan may cause birth defects but there is not enough data to confirm. Acetaminophen and albuterol are generally considered safe during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valproic acid has been associated with an increased risk of birth defects when taken during pregnancy, particularly neural tube defects. Sumatriptan and albuterol have not been shown to increase fetal risk when taken in pregnancy, while acetaminophen is considered safe for most pregnant women.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, Valproic acid has been shown to be associated with an increased risk of birth defects when used during pregnancy. It is recommended to switch to an alternative medication if possible for pregnant women with epilepsy or migraine headaches. Acetaminophen and Albuterol are generally considered safe during pregnancy, while Sumatriptan has limited data but is thought to pose a low risk.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valproic acid is known to cause neural tube defects and should be avoided during pregnancy. Acetaminophen is generally considered safe, while Sumatriptan is a category C drug which should be used with caution during pregnancy. Albuterol is also considered safe.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, Valproic acid has been associated with an increased risk of neural tube defects and other developmental abnormalities in the fetus. Acetaminophen and Albuterol are generally safe during pregnancy, while Sumatriptan is associated with a slightly increased risk of birth defects. However, the frequency of use and dosage must be taken into consideration when evaluating the risk to the fetus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valproic acid is known to cause birth defects and should be avoided during pregnancy. Acetaminophen and albuterol are considered safe during pregnancy, while the safety of sumatriptan is unclear.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valproic acid is a Category D medication, meaning it has been shown to pose a risk to the fetus in humans. Sumatriptan has not been shown to cause birth defects in humans, but can cause decreased fetal weight and increased incidence of skeletal abnormalities in animal studies. Acetaminophen and albuterol are generally considered safe for use during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Valproic acid is a known teratogen and has been associated with neural tube defects and other abnormalities. Sumatriptan is a category C medication and should be used with caution in pregnancy, while Acetaminophen and Albuterol are generally considered safe to use.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s past medical history of migraine headaches and seizures indicates she may be taking valproic acid, which has been associated with increased risks of neural tube defects and other malformations in developing fetuses. Acetaminophen and albuterol are generally regarded as safe for use during pregnancy, while sumatriptan should be used with caution and only if the benefits outweigh the risks.
